page.title: 04RUNCORN'S LOCAL PLACE NAMES
page.content: Runcorn is a town,which has witnessed many changes over the past 20 years, for a new town has slowly enveloped the surrounding countryside.The only clues to the past now lie in the names of the new estates and streets. Barnfield Avenue,Palacefields and Brookvale are now home to thousands of people where once,not so very long ago crops grew and cattle grazed.Windmill Hill,as its name suggests was open hillside and boasted a windmill.Now it is a large estate with 2 schools,a church and a local shop.Halton Castle, which sits in ruins upon the hill above Halton Village,used to survey the fields which separated Halton from Runcorn.Now the gap has been filled by estates,which take their names from the castle and village,such as Halton Brook,Halton Brow and Castlefields.
